name: WooCommerce Taxonomy Report
author: Codeat

sections.description:
• Add the reports (total or subtotal) for any custom taxonomies (also protuct tag)
  • Create Brands, Vendors, Artist, Authors, State and/or City taxonomy in a click
  • Fully compatible with other Vendors and Brands Plugins

GitHub Plugin’s Page – Open an Issue on GitHub
sections.installation:
Using The WordPress Dashboard

  1. Navigate to the ‘Add New’ in the plugins dashboard
  2. Search for ‘woocommerce-taxonomy-report’
  3. Click ‘Install Now’
  4. Activate the plugin on the Plugin dashboard

Uploading in WordPress Dashboard

  1. Navigate to the ‘Add New’ in the plugins dashboard
  2. Navigate to the ‘Upload’ area
  3. Select woo-taxonomy-report.zip from your computer
  4. Click ‘Install Now’
  5. Activate the plugin in the Plugin dashboard

Using FTP

  1. Download woo-taxonomy-report.zip
  2. Extract the woo-taxonomy-report directory to your computer
  3. Upload the woo-taxonomy-report directory to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory
  4. Activate the plugin in the Plugin dashboard
sections.faq:
Where can I add taxonomies to reports?

You can find all your active taxonomies listed under the Integration Tab in the WooCommerce Settings Panel. Select taxonomies and save.

Where can I add Brands and/or Vendors taxonomies to WooCommerce?

Under the Integration Tab, in the WooCommerce Settings Panel, select taxonomies you need to add to your store and save.
For multiselect just keep pressing ctrl while you are selecting more than one taxonomy.
sections.changelog:
1.0.2

  • Use manage_woocommerce for permissions instead of just admin users

1.0.2

  • Fix to avoid loop on refresh tab

1.0.1

  • Improvement on WooCommerce detection also on multiste
  • Removed sidebar in settings that creates problems on saving

1.0

  • First release

short_description: Add any custom taxonomy to your WooCommerce reports, also with tag. It comes with some optionally usefull extra taxonomies like brands.
